attributes.text: Navigation Module Above

Renders logo module, navbar module, burger module. Selecting the burger toggle makes navbar module appear with nav elements inside. Options to place underline border on any nav item. Option for image to be placed inside of navbar.
Header Module

The Header module is a banner that can have a large image, title, a background texture image, and multiple colors. All of these elements are optional.
  • Two variations of mobile design (normal, alt-layout)
  • Background texture image is available, non texture image most likely will look unpleasant if uploaded in that spot
  • If title,image,backgroundImage are not passed, two colored banner is presented

The Label Module is a headline with larger bolded text

Options
  • Text size: sm, md, lg text
  • Align: left, right, center
  • Border or no border
  • Gap spacing or no gap spacing
Label: With gap, no border

attributes.text:
• Portrays images in multiple grid formats
  • Image can contain buttons, headlines, and descriptions
  • Aspect ratio of images 4/3
  • Description can be provided and slides up on top of the image on hover.
  • If a linkUrl is provided, images are black and white until hovered on

Options
  • Gap: Can have spacing gap or no spacing gap between photos
  • Layout: Various layout options for different number of images included
  • If headline is provided it can be used instead of link text

Layouts (Visual examples below)
  • 3-1/3: Three images, each one takes up one third of element
  • 3-2/3: Three images, first image takes up two thirds of element
  • 2-1/2: Two images, each one takes up half of element
  • 2-2/3: Two images, first image takes up two thirds of element.
  • 1-full: One image that takes up full element
  • 1-hero: One image that takes up full element but aspect ratio of image is 16/9
  • Four or more images: Images are displayed in rows of 3
